t: To the chief Musician, Alâ€“taschith, Michtam of David; when Saul sent, and they watched the house to kill him.
Deliver*p me from mine enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me.
Deliver*p me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.
For,*p lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O Lord.*s
They*p run and prepare themselves without my fault: awake to help me, and behold.
Thou*p therefore, O Lord*s God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.
They*p return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.
Behold,*p they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?
But*p thou, O Lord,*s shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.
Because*p of his strength will I wait upon thee: for God is my defence.
The*p God of my mercy shall prevent me: God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.
Slay*p them not, lest my people forget: scatter them by thy power; and bring them down, O Lord our shield.
For*p the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying which they speak.
Consume*p them in wrath, consume them, that they may not be: and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob unto the ends of the earth. Selah.
And*p at evening let them return; and let them make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.
Let*p them wander up and down for meat, and grudge if they be not satisfied.
But*p I will sing of thy power; yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.
Unto*p thee, O my strength, will I sing: for God is my defence, and the God of my mercy.
